sentence: Just one week after the catastrophe, candidate for governor Lou Barletta sent out a campaign email blast blaming Democrats for the collapse.
author: Rep. Dan Frankel
title: Rep. Dan Frankel: Bridge collapse symbol of toxic politics, but doesn’t have to be

sentence: Former Rep. Lou Barletta, a hard-liner on immigration, was listed as a so-called alternate elector in Trump allies’ strategy to overturn the 2020 election — an illegitimate effort to send a completing slate of electors to Congress to stop the ascertainment of Biden’s win.
title: Inside the chaotic GOP primary for governor in Pennsylvania

sentence: The four — Lou Barletta, Jake Corman, Bill McSwain and Dave White — issued the joint statement Monday night, eight weeks before the May 17 primary election.
author: Associated Press
title: 4 GOP candidates for Pa. governor set rules to join a debate

sentence: It was a lighthearted reprieve from an hour of consensus, as Lou Barletta, Bill McSwain, Jake Corman and Dave White — those in the field who have registered by name in recent polling — mostly agreed on the need to unleash Pennsylvania’s energy sector, cut the corporate net income tax rate and make the state less of a regulatory maze for businesses.
author: Julian Routh
title: GOP governor candidates take magic wand approach to fix one thing in Pennsylvania

sentence: Former congressman Lou Barletta, state Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman, former U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain and former Delaware County councilman Dave White won’t take part in any debate that is not moderated by a Republican who lives in the state.
title: Editorial: GOP candidates should embrace better debates

sentence: Corman’s withdrawal still would have left eight Republican candidates vying for the party’s nomination, including McSwain, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, state Sen. Doug Mastriano and former Delaware County Councilman Dave White.
author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
title: Jake Corman is staying in the Republican race for Pennsylvania governor after moving to drop out

sentence: The other four candidates — including poll front-runners state Sen. Doug Mastriano of Franklin County and ex-U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta of Hazleton — demanded a partisan moderator and did not participate.
title: 5 takeaways from Spotlight PA’s Republican gubernatorial debate
